intro: Gymnosporia livingstonei, commonly known as the Livingstone's thornveld, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening despite its thorny appearance.
